channel.title: Program time limit removing
channel.description: Ok this is true and if you never knew it, it is true lol..Now firstly I heard you can take a program and just keep it forever...now here's what I mean...Let's say you go and install a 15day trial of world of warcraft i don't know...so, if you find the code inside of the program that makes it a 15 day trial and replace with a permanent code so it never expires...so how the hell do you do that?? Lmao :D

item.title: Program time limit removing
item.dc:creator: @exps35 exps35
item.description:
@exps35 wrote:

YourDistracted:

Umm they aren’t dumb serials and stuff like that don’t work on mmorpg. Unless you change the files on the server.

Exactly. The 15 day trial is in the server and the account you log onto, and is not anywhere on your computer. Blizzard’s servers hold account information, your computer holds game information such as models, settings and ambiance/music.

Now this isnt necissarily true for applications such as Photoshop CS or MIRC, or games with a single player mode such as Black & White 2 or The Sims. For those, all you need is a keygenerator, which simply uses the pattern of numbers and letters that you find written on the back of the CD. It then gives you an authentic serial, which nobody ever checks because you dont go online with it

Read full topic
